text:
(1)
2416 and 2420 First Avenue, east side, at 124th Street. May 23, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, a closer view of the junk shop. The filling station on the S.E. corner occupies the site of a one-story shop which has been torn down. May 23, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

(1)
2416 and 2420 First Avenue, east side, at 124th Street. May 23, 1934.

(2)
The same, a closer view of the junk shop. The filling station on the S.E. corner occupies the site of a one-story shop which has been torn down. May 23, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

(1)
First Avenue, west side, from 124th to 125th Streets, a view north showing the Willis Avenue Bridge at the northern end of
First Avenue.
Demolition of some of these houses has already begun.
June 21, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same block, another view. All the houses except the two at and adjoining the corner of 124th Street are being demolished
for the Triborough Bridge Plaza.
June 21, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, not showing the two houses left standing at the 124th
Street end of the block.
June 21, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
First Ave., east side, north from, but not including East 124th to and including 125th Streets. Shown also is the Approach to the Willis
Ave. Bridge.
May 23, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same.
September 19, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

(1)
First Ave., east side, north from, but not including East 124th to and including 125th Streets. Shown also is the Approach to the Willis
Ave. Bridge.
May 23, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same.
September 19, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

First Avenue, east side, from 125th to 124th Streets, across clearing.

P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

September 19, 1934.

(1)
East 124th Street, north side, east from (No. 415), but not including First Ave. Note freight station of the Lehigh Valley R.R. at the river end of the street.

September 19, 1934.

P.L. Sperr.

(2)
The same; at a later date. Notice the Triborough Bridge on East 125th Street.

May 18, 1936.

P.L. Sperr.

(1)
East 124th Street, north side, east from (No. 415), but not including First Ave. Note freight station of the Lehigh Valley R.R. at the river end of the street.

September 19, 1934.

(2)
The same; at a later date. Notice the Triborough Bridge on East 125th Street.

May 18, 1936.

P.L. Sperr.

(1) East 124th Street, west from, (No. 317), but not including First Ave. Note Elevated Lines on Second and Third Aves., respective.

June 21, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same; from a point further eastward, and only showing the north side.

June 21, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) East 124th Street, west from, (No. 317), but not including First Ave. Note Elevated Lines on Second and Third Aves., respective.

June 21, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same; from a point further eastward, and only showing the north side.

June 21, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) East 124th Street, north side, east from Second, to and including First Aves. Note Second Ave. Elevated overhead. May 23, 1934. P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same; from a different angle. Note demolition in progress on the N.E. corner of Second Ave. July 19, 1934. P. L. Sperr.

(2) must be earlier than

(1) because it still has bldg.

(1) East 124th Street, north side, east from Second, to and including First Aves. Note Second Ave. Elevated overhead. May 23, 1934. P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same; from a different angle. Note demolition in progress on the N.E. corner of Second Ave. July 19, 1934. P. L. Sperr.

(2) must be earlier than

(1) because it still has bldg.

(1) First Ave., north from and including East 124th., to and including 125th Streets, as seen across clearance for the Manhattan Approach to the Tri-Borough Bridge. Also shown is East 124th Street, north side, west from and including First, to and including Second Aves. On the right, appears a rear view of East 126th Street, south side, west from, but not including First Ave. Notice Second Ave., Elevated Line on Second Ave.

September 17, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, as seen from East 125th Street. Note surface car and Second Ave., Elevated station on said street.

September 17, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, showing a view further northward.

September 17, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) First Ave., north from and including East 124th., to and including 125th Streets, as seen across clearance for the Manhattan Approach to the Tri-Borough Bridge. Also shown is East 124th Street, north side, west from and including First, to and including Second Aves. On the right, appears a rear view of East 126th Street, south side, west from, but not including First Ave. Notice Second Ave., Elevated Line on Second Ave.

September 17, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, as seen from East 125th Street. Note surface car and Second Ave., Elevated station on said street.

September 17, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, showing a view further northward.

September 17, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) First Ave., north from and including East 124th., to and including 125th Streets, as seen across clearance for the Manhattan Approach to the Tri-Borough Bridge. Also shown is East 124th Street, north side, west from and including First, to and including Second Aves. On the right, appears a rear view of East 126th Street, south side, west from, but not including First Ave. Notice Second Ave., Elevated Line on Second Ave.

September 17, 1935.

September 17, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

First Ave., west side, between East 124th and 125th Streets.
September 17, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
First Ave., south from, and including East 124th Street. as seen from the Manhattan Approach to the Tri Borough Bridge. Note the construction shack at the S.E. corner of 124th Street.

August 3, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A view of the east side of First Ave., between 124th and 123rd Streets. Also shown on the left, is the curved structual bedway of the bridge approach from the East River Drive.

August 3, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

(1)
First Ave., south from, and including East 124th Street. as seen from the Manhattan Approach to the Tri Borough Bridge. Note the construction shack at the S.E. corner of 124th Street.

August 3, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A view of the east side of First Ave., between 124th and 123rd Streets. Also shown on the left, is the curved structual bedway of the bridge approach from the East River Drive.

August 3, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

East 124th Street, at the N.W. corner of First Ave. Shown is a portion of the Manhattan approach to the Triborough Bridge.

May 18, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Triboro Bridge: The Manhattan Approach as viewed eastward on East 125th Street at First Ave. The new East River Drive will have a circular by-pass approach to this structure and will be on the right.
January 17, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same structure slightly later. The constructdon shack seen,is at the N.E. corner of First Ave. (foreground) at East 124th Street;
the view being northeastward.
March 10, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same date as No. 2; viewing in the opposite direction and showing this new structure crossing the old Willis Ave. - First Ave., Harlem River Bridge. The tenements seen,face on the south side of
East 126th Street, between First and Second Aves.
March 10, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(3 views, not dry mount items).
title: Bridges - Triborough Bridge - Manhattan Approach.
